{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tumor suppressor genes are genes that regulate cell division and prevent the formation of tumors. pRb, p16, and PTCH are all known tumor suppressor genes. pRb regulates cell cycle progression, p16 inhibits cyclin dependent kinases, and PTCH is involved in the Hedgehog signaling pathway, which is important for cell growth and differentiation. On the other hand, c-erbB1, also known as EGFR, is not a tumor suppressor gene.
